content: red color changes are indicated by font color for plain version - skip the color changes ch2 and join with a single_crochet to the marked stitch on the first leg then work round 6 5sc decrease 6sc 2sc in chain 6sc decrease 6sc 2sc in chain 30 round 7 30sc 30 round 8 6sc decrease 13sc decrease 7sc 28 round 9 13sc single_crochet 14sc 28 round 10 5sc decrease 5sc 3sc 4sc decrease 7sc 26 round 11 10sc 5sc 11sc 26 stuff the legs stuff the body as you go round 12 5sc decrease 2sc 7sc 2sc decrease 6sc 24 round 13 8sc 7sc 9sc 24 round 14 4sc decrease 3sc 2sc single_crochet 2sc 2sc decrease 6sc 22 f/o red only now we will attach the arms to the body by crocheting them together in the following round they should be aligned with the sides of the body depending on your gauge you may need to adjust their placement round 15 3sc 4sc on both arm and body 7sc 4sc on both arm and body 4sc 22 round 16 22sc 22 5 © 2026 by @pracowniablask all rights reserved round 17 5sc decrease 8sc decrease 5sc 20 5 round 18 2sc decrease x5 15 round 19 single_crochet decrease x5 10 stuff the body completely f/o and sew the hole closed weave in the yarn end antennas | make 2 6 join red to the top of the head ch5 and f/o trim the excess yarn and weave in the ends using black yarn embroider the eyes between rounds 16 and 18 three stitches apart wings | make 2 7 wings are crocheted with red don t stuff at all one wing is made of two parts part 1 | make 2 round 1 6sc in magic_ring 8 round 2 6inc 12 round 3 increase 5sc x2 14 round 4 14sc 14 f/o with an invisible join and mark the last stitch with a stitch marker put them aside for now 6 © 2026 by @pracowniablask all rights reserved part 2 | make 2 round 1-4 repeat the same instructions as for the part 1 now we will attach the second part of the wing to the first one join with a single_crochet to the marked stitch on the first part then work round 5 13sc on the first part 14sc on the second part 28 round 6 2dec 10sc x2 24 round 7 2dec 8sc x2 20 round 8 2dec 6sc x2 16 round 9 2dec 4sc x2 12 round 10 decrease 4sc x2 10 round 11 4dec leave the remaining stitches unworked f/o and sew the hole closed leave a long tail for sewing align your wings on the back of your make at a 45° angle between rounds 10 and 15 sew them as indicated by marked points and that s it 9 10 11 7 © 2026 by @pracowniablask all rights reserved add a keychain to make a little ♥ gift for your beloved ones thank you
